remarks: A set is well-founded if all of its elements are well-founded. Proposition 9.12 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 78.  The main proof consists of ~ tz9.12lem1 through ~ tz9.12lem3 .  (Contributed by NM, 22-Sep-2003.)
statement:
tz9.12.1 $e |- A e. _V $.
tz9.12 $p |- ( A. x e. A E. y e. On x e. ( R1 ` y ) -> E. y e. On A e. ( R1 ` y ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
